metadata.title: CVE-2013-4449 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
The rwm overlay in OpenLDAP 2.4.23, 2.4.36, and earlier does not properlycount references, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial ofservice (slapd crash) by unbinding immediately after a search request,which triggers rwm_conn_destroy to free the session context while it isbeing used by rwm_op_search.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4449` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldap-utils - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.1
libldap-2.4-2 - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.1
slapd - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.1
slapd-smbk5pwd - 2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openldap package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.31-1+nmu2ubuntu8.1').
